definition: definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]

sentences.english: Animal wants and appetites are some of the readiest instances of the End.
sentences.chinese: 人們的需要和意欲可說是目的的最切近例子。

sentences.english: Elbows fitting closely to sides, neither loose nor tied.
sentences.chinese: 肘切近身材兩側，不松也不緊。

sentences.english: Strangelove:When I approached it, I heard a voice.
sentences.chinese: 當我切近時，我聽到了她的聲音。

sentences.english: Furthermore, bamboo is very close to Chinese consciousness of revival.
sentences.chinese: 竹與中國古人惜命重生意識也極爲切近。

sentences.english: At closer range, it more closely resembles mercantilism.
sentences.chinese: 更切近點說，這看起來更像重商主義。

sentences.english: The readiest instance of Being-for-self is found in the 'I'.
sentences.chinese: “我”是自爲存在的最切近的例子。

sentences.english: This explanatory note seems to be closer to what is ment by the author.
sentences.chinese: 這樣註解比較切近作者原意。

definition: distantly remote/also written 邈遠|邈远[miao3 yuan3]
to hit the target (esp. in argument)/to strike home
amiable (manner)/unassuming/written in plain language/easy to take in
miscellaneous/mixed and disorderly (of writing)/disordered and confusing/mixed-up and illogical
